description: Named for the hypnotist character Svengali in George du Maurier's novel Trilby. More at citations.

entries.meaning: One who manipulates or controls another as by some mesmeric or sinister influence; especially a coach, mentor or industry mogul.
examples: She also offers a fascinating glimpse into a more innocent age before svengalis began colluding with marketing men and TV execs to promote talentless wannabes to overnight success.
